snippet: With polar ice melting each year, the governments of five countries with Arctic coastline said an agreement regulating commercial fishing was warranted.
abstract: Governments of United States, Russia, Norway, Denmark and Canada, five countries with Arctic coastline, conclude that enough of polar ice cap melts regularly in summertime that agreement regulating commercial fishing in now open water near North Pole is warranted.
lead_paragraph: With polar ice melting each year, the governments of five countries with Arctic coastline said an agreement regulating commercial fishing was warranted.

headline.seo: Agreement Would Regulate Fishing in Arctic Waters
headline.main: Accord Would Regulate Fishing in Arctic Waters
headline.print_headline: Accord Would Regulate Fishing in Arctic Waters
